September 8, 2002: Fiction
RED RABBIT, by Tom Clancy. (Putnam, $28.95.) In the early 1980's, when he is a
novice in the C.I.A., Jack Ryan must act to thwart a Soviet plot against Pope John
Paul II.
THE LOVELY BONES, by Alice Sebold. (Little, Brown, $21.95.) A 14-year-old girl
looks down from heaven as she describes what happens in the aftermath of her
kidnapping and murder.
STANDING IN THE RAINBOW, by Fannie Flagg. (Random House, $25.95.) Life in
Elmwood Springs, Mo., from 1946 to the present.
THE REMNANT, by Tim LaHaye and Jerry B. Jenkins. (Tyndale, $24.99.) Volume
10 of the "Left Behind" series, in which the forces of good battle the forces of evil
after the rapture of the saved.
THE BEACH HOUSE, by James Patterson and Peter de Jonge. (Little, Brown,
$26.95.) After his brother drowns in East Hampton, a law student seeks revenge
on the powerful people who he thinks are responsible.
THE NANNY DIARIES, by Emma McLaughlin and Nicola Kraus. (St. Martin's,
$24.95.) A satirical look at New Yorkers through the eyes of an East Side nanny.
SHADOW PUPPETS, by Orson Scott Card. (Tor/Tom Doherty, $25.95.) After
staving off an alien invasion, child-warriors return to find Earth in turmoil.
A LOVE OF MY OWN, by E. Lynn Harris. (Doubleday, $24.95.) The C.E.O. and
the editor in chief of Bling Bling magazine look for true love in New York City.
ELEVENTH HOUR, by Catherine Coulter. (Putnam, $24.95.) When his identical
twin brother, a priest, is murdered, an F.B.I. agent searches for the killer.
THE APPRENTICE, by Tess Gerritsen. (Ballantine, $24.95.) Investigating murders
that resemble those of a jailed serial killer, a policewoman becomes a target.
SUNSET IN ST. TROPEZ, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $19.95.) Surprises await
a group of friends who decide to spend August on the Riviera.
STONE KISS, by Faye Kellerman. (Warner, $25.95.) Surprises await a group of
friends who decide to spend August on the Riviera.
THE DIVE FROM CLAUSEN'S PIER, by Ann Packer. (Knopf, $24.) A young
woman whose fiance has been rendered a quadriplegic decides to start a new life.
THE EMPEROR OF OCEAN PARK, by Stephen L. Carter. (Knopf, $26.95.) The
patriarch of a black family dies under mysterious circumstances.
PARTNER IN CRIME, by J. A. Jance. (Morrow, $24.95.) After an artist is
September 8, 2002
Non-Fiction
LET'S ROLL! by Lisa Beamer with Ken Abraham. (Tyndale, $24.99.) A memoir by
the wife of Todd Beamer, one of the passengers on United Flight 93 on Sept. 11.
A MIND AT A TIME, by Mel Levine. (Simon & Schuster, $26.) A professor of
pediatrics examines the learning patterns of children and the various ways in
which parents and other adults can help them succeed.
LET FREEDOM RING, by Sean Hannity. (ReganBooks/ HarperCollins, $25.95.)
The conservative commentator surveys domestic and foreign issues after Sept.
SLANDER, by Ann Coulter. (Crown, $25.95.) The lawyer and pundit enumerates
"liberal lies about the American right."
WHAT WE SAW, by CBS News. (Simon & Schuster, $29.95.) Sept. 11 in words
and pictures, with a DVD.
STUPID WHITE MEN, by Michael Moore. (ReganBooks/ HarperCollins, $24.95.)
The man behind "Roger & Me" takes aim at our "nation of idiots."
THE LOBSTER CHRONICLES, by Linda Greenlaw. (Hyperion, $22.95.) The
author of "The Hungry Ocean" gives up swordfishing and moves back in with her
parents on the island where she grew up.
AMONG THE HEROES, by Jere Longman. (Harper- Collins, $24.95.) A journalist's
account of the passengers and crew of United Flight 93, the hijacked jet that
crashed in a field in Pennsylvania on Sept. 11.
GOOD TO GREAT, by Jim Collins. (HarperBusiness, $27.50.) Why some
companies thrive and others do not.
THE CELL, by John Miller and Michael Stone with Chris Mitchell. (Hyperion,
$24.95.) An investigation of the terrorist operatives behind the Sept. 11 attacks.
SACRED CONTRACTS, by Caroline Myss. (Harmony, $25.) Reflections on
"spiritual energies" and the meaning of life by the author of "Anatomy of the Spirit."
NEVER FORGET, by Mitchell Fink and Lois Mathias. (ReganBooks/HarperCollins,
$24.95.) An oral history of the attacks of Sept. 11 and their aftermath.
THE RIGHT WORDS AT THE RIGHT TIME, edited by Marlo Thomas. (Atria, $25.)
More than 100 celebrities describe a turning point in their lives.
RUNNING WITH SCISSORS, by Augusten Burroughs. (St. Martin's, $23.95.) A
memoir of a psychiatrist who went crazy while a young boy (the author) was in his
care.
